content:
Posted: November 18, 2015
AT A GLANCE(Full review follows below)Game Name: Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage Original Release: 2013 Genre Tags: Simulation; Casual; Comedy; First-Person; Gore   My Overall Grade: B Estimated Playtime (Campaign): 3-9 hours Multiplayer Aspect: Optional Recommended To: Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Novelty seekers; Casual gamersREVIEWViscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage is a funny, simple game that shouldn’t be taken seriously.  It is a “simulator” style game with purposefully “silly” controls and movement.  It is the kind of game where there isn’t much to it, but it is fun while it lasts.  Expect a handful of hours of playtime.There is only one map and it is pretty small, but is actually perfectly sized.  It is designed well; big enough that you can enjoy looking around without it being too big that things get boring trying to clean.  The amount of time it takes to actually beat the campaign (read: finish cleaning everything) is just enough to be substantial without getting too tedious— 1 to 2 hours.  The game still might get a little tedious if you are going for all the achievements.For the most part, though, it is pretty damn entertaining.  As you look around at the mess that you are cleaning, you’ll notice that it tells the story of what happened.  It is very amusing. There are several little Easter eggs and such as well.It has multiplayer where you can connect directly to a friend.  The game would definitely be more fun to play with someone than alone.  I feel this is a kind of game that would have greatly benefitted from old school local multiplayer.  I feel like it would be fun to sit on a couch with your significant-lover or a buddy and play a stupid game like this.  Perhaps it will be added at a future date from when I wrote this.Ultimately, though, don’t expect too much.  You’ll get an amusing couple of hours, maybe a bit more if you bring a friend and/or unlock the achievements.  After that, you will never play it again.  Of course, Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage is also probably best enjoyed around the holidays, as it is extra comical when juxtaposed with all the real holiday spirit you will be exposed to in real life.Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations!

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												First of all, this is not a long game.  It is, however, entertaining for the content it does have.  If you've ever heard the Weird Al song "The Night Santa Went Crazy," this videogame explores the aftermath.  Based on the Viscera Cleanup Detail series of games, instead of being set in a typical video game world ("Space Janitors!"), this one takes place in Santa's Workshop, where you play the one elf who appears to have stayed home the night before.  The rest your fellow toymakers can be found strewn about the workshop in various pieces.  Santa's Rampage has left no survivors, (no, not even the reindeer), and it's up to you to clean up the mess.Your job here is to mop up the spills and smears of blood, pick up and dispose of any inappropriate objects and generally return the workshop to it's original state, as much as possible, given that at least one door was blown off its hinges.  Gameplay is fairly simple, though sometimes a bit wonky in the controls.  You get a mop, a "mess detector" and a pair of gloves.  You can also pick up buckets of water or biohazard bins to help in the cleanup.  You use the mop to wipe up the mess, then dunk the dirty mop into a clean bucket of water, cleaning the mop, but eventually dirtying the water.  Disposal of waste is handled in the most efficient manner possible: the fireplace, of course,   Care must be taken because some objects are more volatile than others, and disposing of them in the fireplace can be hazardous to your health.   But a steady hand, and lots of patience will see you through the game.It's not high entertainment by any stretch of the imagination, but for an hour or so of laughing every time you pick up a mangled elf corpse ("Fritz!  He killed Fritz!  That lousy, stinking, pot-bellied slave-driver! That despicable animal toy-monger!"), nothing beats Santa's Rampage.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2013
												It's cheap, yet gives quite a refreshing experience.Basically, Santa got mad and terrorized everyone in the workshop, and you are here to clean up. The game isn't violent, it's just that it's very bloody.The whole process takes about 1.5 - 2 hrs (at least on your first try).You will have to get rid of the bodies (by burning), then wipe away the blood and get rid of all the broken stuff, then a bit of layout adjustment.You might be thinking that it is too repetitive and will become boring, but in fact it isn't like that at all.One really impressive thing is the sense of completion this game gives you. If you step on the blood you will leave footprints, that's why you are most likely to clean areas bit by bit. You really feel how the place changes around you. There is also coop in this game.I am dead serious. No joke. Give this game a try. This game itself is a short demo to their upcoming game that is set in a space station (with numerous levels to choose from). The is also another demo which features the first level of the newly released Shadow Warrior remake, but personally, i think this is a better version.Also, it costs about 2$.

Ho ho ho I chopped some elvesRating: OkSanta's had bad a bad day and unloaded his guns on his elves. You have to clean up the mess after he left to deliver some packages. Pretty funny game in the Viscera's series. Fun for a while but it soon gets a bit boring. As you are a lot of time in the same space and virtually nothing happens other than you wiping the floor. The handling of all the stuff is a bit cluncky so you now and then kick your own bucket and you can start over again. Like the real life of a janitor I suppose. One annoying thing to mention is that you cannot save the game so if you want to clean the whole place you better reserve some time. You also don't have an indication about your progress other than the stuff you don't see anymore. The 'real' game is still in alpha so i guess this 'by-product' shows the state of the game at the moment. Fun for a little while.

Posted: March 19
												 you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients- To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting - To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs, lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper- ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling.- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough.- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn’t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells.- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a “homemade” touch as well.- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.- Roll the dough into two sheets- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.- Fill with the ravioli mixture.- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli.- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest - Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

═══════════════════════════════════OVERVIEWViscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage is a first-person janitor simulator... yes, you heard me, janitor simulator. Viscera Cleanup Detail games are pretty fun, each has their own unique story like this one; drunk Santa went on a rampage, killing elves and trashing his workshop with dynamites because he got tired of everything, this is clearly a GOTY material. Jokes aside, I had fun with this game, graphics are nice, there are a lot of easter eggs, hard and funny achievements and other cool stuff you can experiment with.═══════════════════════════════════PROS & CONSPros:Makes cleaning funAwesome graphicsCleaning mechanicsDon't want to spoil it, but there's dynamite tooCons:Too shortOnly 1 areaSome achievements are annoying to doNot suitable for children═══════════════════════════════════SUMMARY & FINAL RATINGThis game is for everyone that wants to clean take a break from shooters while still playing something violent. I rate the game 8/10, would get stuck on the tiny elf body holding a NERF gun again!═══════════════════════════════════For more recommendations and reviews on our favourite up and coming quality games follow Lot's O Giveaway's group curations here!

content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
												As someone that hates cleaning in real life, this game is very Zen to play for some reason, possibly because I'm OCD... Unless you play with friends then it can be a damn nightmare depending if you want screw around. This fun little standalone game only contains the one map, but for the low price you can't complain. You must clean the mess after a rampaging Santa and save/ruin Christmas for everyone. There is lots of little things in this game that make it funny and allow you to piece together the tragic story together on what you think happened. Lots of little notes you can pick up and read, reading the books on the shelf, as well as just looking at how the elf corpses are scattered around the map... Or blowing up yourself and your friend with the TNT found in the map.Not really a whole lot to explain, other than look up some videos and screenshots. If it looks interesting to you then give it a try, otherwise you may not enjoy it.Pros:- Short little game.- Funny humor.- Coop- Cheap price point.- Easy achievements. (Only took me 5 hours to 100%)Cons:- Game can be a little glitchy sometimes with the physics, even more so if you play online and experience any high ping with people.- Will always be the same map, nothing changes game to game.- No Steam Cards.Good buy for the price, and enjoyable to play with friends, would recommend it!

content:
Posted: December 15, 2013
												..I played this while watching twitch to scratch my Christmas itch (ahem)..If you like to play games as a bit of a completionist and taking your time - and seeing your progress gives you a little buzz, then this is a strangely addictive way to spend a few hours. It IS based on a game in alpha/beta status, and the devs have said basically that "things go wrong" in that items (mostly swords & stuff) can glitch into the floor. I had one item I couldn't reach and two more that were reached with the console command to remove 'dirty' items (supported by the devs for this exact reason). Otherwise you would have to be VERY careful during your play-through and restart if any items fell into the world, as you enter and leave your 'job' – no saving.A couple of the achievements are going to be utterly infuriating if you want to 100% it so perhaps pass it over if that's your thing until it's fixed. Yes, it's super simple. Yes it's not for everyone.. But I seriously.. really loved playing it & for less than £2 it was a good way to spend an evening, even if slightly masochistic.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4, 2014
												I played this off the back of watching a film by the name of "Sunshine Cleaning", it's a charming yarn about a pair of sisters played by Amy Adams and Emily Blunt. One sister (Adams) is a smart determined single mother gritting it out as a cleaner to support a slightly problematic child whilst at the same time fitting in an affair with a married man who has absolutely no respect for himself, Adams or his pregnant wife!!....the other (Blunt) is caught half way between being a dreamer and a screw up. To cut a long story short out of necessity they form a crime scene cleaning company by the name of Sunshine Cleaning, burn down a house and decimate family relationships only to build them back up again.Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Revenge doesn't feature Amy Adams or Emily Blunt, it doesn't even feature Alan Arkin as a slightly potty father selling popcorn out of the back of a sedan one week then struggling to shift seafood lovingly preserved in his bathtub the next....it did however teach me one thing, which is that this crime scene cleaning lark isn't for me.Upon entering the grotto the game advise's me that Santa has had a break down and went ballistic with a shotgun. Elves are scattered everywhere, limbs are scattered everywhere, the walls and carpets are painted red. I spent 20 minutes walking around in circles following bloody footprints only to realise that they were my own as I'd stepped on an Elve's head when entering the grotto....this is a far cry from getting the hoover out on a Sunday afternoon and following it up with some light dusting and a few sprays of anti-bac surface cleaner. Every few mop strokes im having to ring it out in the water bucket, every few minutes im forced to freshen up the water in the bucket, it's feels like a job and for that the developers deserve massive praise."Sunshine Cleaning" 8/10 - Amy Adams shines in a touching drama about love, life & family.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
												Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage is a cleaning simulator that has you going around and cleaning the aftermath of Santa's descent into elf murdering madness. How much destruction can a jolly old man cause you may be wondering? Well to put it lightly Santa put quite a bit of his free time into knife throwing lessons and has adorned the walls with bloody elf corpses. Limbs are everywhere, the rooms are smeared with blood and Santa even had to nerve to hide a few bodies as to avoid being charged with 100 murders because anything more than 99 is just barbaric. A nice little detail is that searching Santa's office will fill you in as to why he went postal and feel a bit sympathetic for the fat man until you realize that you stepped on some blood and created footprints all the way from the hall. It was around this point that I remembered I was a janitor, not a detective so I went on my merry way to get a bucket of water from this rather odd machine built solely to dispense buckets of water. Back into the room I go, I set down the bucket and turn back only to see a new set of footprints have been made on my way over here.I clean and I clean until my mop starts making more of a bloody mess instead of cleaning any of it and I try to clean my mop in the bucket. As it turns out you have to be at just the right place to dunk it in water but foolish old me just started trying different buttons and ended up smacking the bucket right into Santa's desk and knocking over his whiskey bottles straight to the floor. So out I go to get another bucket of water and the machine plops out a raw hunk of bloody meat dirtying up the area even more. It is at this point that I slowly nod to myself, go back into Santa's office and threw a stack of TNT into the fireplace out of spite. I then left the job site and into the night as I started to realize this wasn't too bright. As you can imagine my boss was more than displeased and this good ole janitor was fired on Christmas Eve. Er, poor Christmas rhymes aside this is one title where you will want to pay attention as the slightest slip up can make the room messy again. As this game also features online coop this will be the perfect title to either work as a team or get them to hate you and your clumsiness.Cleaning is a very time consuming process in this game. Your mop gets dirty and so does the bucket eventually, making you walk all the way back to get another one. Corpses are your biggest concerns as whenever you pick them up and accidentally bump them into something, blood splatters onto the surface of the area. The elves never run out of blood oddly enough so there is no limit to the amount of mess a single corpse can create. At first I simply stuck them into containers but they quickly all filled to the brim. I eyed the fireplace and as it turns out you are actually supposed to cremate them in there. It's not just the corpses and blood you must clean. You are supposed to burn everything from corpses, antlers, whiskey bottles and Santa's guns. If the cheery Christmas melodies start getting on your nerves you can simply toss the jukebox into the fire as well. Even the buckets with the bloody water must be burned. Everything must be burned and the fireplace can be quite some ways from where the mess is so you can stuff them into your giant storage box and carry them back. It would be far easier to simply burn the house down but oh well, that's the life of an underpaid janitor I suppose.As you can no doubt tell by now this game is rather morbid and filled with dark humor. You don't even have to work if you don't want to, you can just toss elf corpse onto the table like if this was a wrestling game. Toss bottles, paint the room red with your bloody mop and stacking all the bodies near the entrance so however enters has one heck of a surprise are some of the things you can have fun with if you are not a cleaning kind of person. There is no price or anything other than achievements for cleaning so there is no real point for doing so unless you are really dedicated to your role of janitor. Only one map to explore and nothing to unlock so what you see is what you get. If you are taking the game seriously and are actually cleaning it should take you a bit over 2 hours to fully clean it if you are by yourself. It is quite a graphic intensive game due to all the objects that you can manipulate and looks pretty good as well however it is a fairly small map. All in all it is a rather enjoyable cleaning game with enough freedom to be able to easily get some decent entertainment for the price. It's not a game I find all to enjoyable personally but if you are in the market for a cleaning game based on the great elf massacre that drove Santa into being a dangerous fugitive then this is the game for you!

content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
												Top fun game. What makes this game even better is that it has coop so you can do it with friends. There are many nice little features within the game, like TNT, molotovs and yes these do blow up. Knives you throw at friends etc. There's are many little things in the game that makes it amazing. The audio is pretty simple with squash squash, bam bam sounds when using wet mops, buckets etc.The controls are really simple, literally really simple and you cannot complain.The mechanics of the game are even simpler... Tidy and use your head about it.  You do not use a bloody bucket to clean a floor do you.... It makes more mess.The coop really sets the game apart... Cleaning together and accidently knocking your friends bucket which is full of blood and whatever making it all messy and more mess, shooting at each other etc, top funIt is stupid cheap which is a perfect buy. I brought this and then brought the official game in space station for $7 and got a free key of this game so I would say go to the website and preorder the official space station version and you get a steam key for both this game and the one coming out. The graphics are actually pretty decent which surprised me. Worth a buy and play.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												This game is so amazing that I couldn't think of what I would be doing around Christmas every year, it's been there for me when I have been extremely bored, and this game is not the usual type I'd play. It's a physics interactivity type game, you're cleaning up after Santa's rampage, where all of the elves are dead. It's a huge mess, so it's going to require a lot of time to clean. Not only that, but they still release really awesome updates, 3 years later after its release, and I'm loving all the new features they've been working on.What makes this game all the more amazing, is that the creator(s) haven't left this game yet, they still put love and time into it, and that's pretty much why I enjoy playing it every year, like I don't remember how all the last times went.If you like a game where your job is to clean an entire building, then this game is for you!

content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												Now this is bizarre. Instead of being the hellraiser, you're the cleaner. In this game, you clean up messes. Yeah.This is the third Viscera Cleanup Detail. There's the Shadow Warrior one, which came with the base game. You clean up the bodies Lo Wang left behind. Then there's the original Viscera Cleanup Detail, where you clean up the mess a generic space marine left behind when he was having all the fun. Now, you're cleaning up a mess Santa made. The mess where he murdered all of his elves.The gameplay is simple enough. You get a mop, and a blood detector. Your goal is to clean up the blood, and get rid of all harmful items. A water bucket and a disposal bin are also included in your arsenal of cleanliness. You need to dispose of the dead bodies, shattered whiskey bottles, and so on. The only real hazards in this game are the TNT around that can blow up, and the fact that you can make more blood with footsteps and your dirty mop, which needs frequent cleaning. It's simple, but hey, the game's cheap, and is always being updated. It's a clever idea, executed very well. It definitely won't cater to everyone's tastes, but it is a fun time waster. If you like to clean, you're gonna have a field day with this one.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												The paper-thin premise for this game is that you are a janitor whose job it is to clean up the mess Santa Claus made after he went postal at the North Pole. That's about it for story and background, but if you're interested in this title, you're not here for the in-depth plot and character development (which is good, because there is none).You arrive in Santa's workshop and you see the entire place is a huge mess. There are body parts (of both elves and the reindeer, including Rudolph) strewn all over the area. There's copious amounts of blood and other chunky pieces of meat in various places, sometimes even in areas you wouldn't normally expect.A lot of detail has gone into the environment, including a hole blasted through a wall (complete with scorch marks) and numerous items, ranging from chairs to presents to toy guns (which the elves apparently used to "defend" themselves against Santa) that you can interact with. Just about everything can be manipulated through the game's physics engine, so while it can be neat to see how one item can affect another, it can also lead to awkward positioning. For instance, there are bio-hazard boxes you can use, but it's often a real chore to get the elves' broken, twisted, and sometimes dismembered bodies into them. What usually ends up happening is you'll see an elf's head or leg clip through the side of the box, which will then sometimes lead to the box jumping around by itself. Basically, it's the same old problem ragdoll physics have always had when bumping up against an object.Now... onto the cleaning. Your mop can clean up blood, but in the process it gets blood-soaked. After a while your mop will start spreading and smearing blood. When this happens, you can grab a bucket of water and rinse the mop. It'll be clean again and available to wipe away various bloody bits. However, each time you rinse the mop, the water in the bucket gets bloodier and bloodier. Eventually the bucket will be so bloody (and this is readily apparent) that dipping your mop in there will only serve to get more blood on it. Fortunately, you can get an unlimited number of buckets of clean water from a machine in Santa's workshop, although sometimes that same machine spits out a torn off leg or an unidentifiable chunk of flesh.To keep people interested long after the novelty of wiping away blood has grown stale, the developer put in a bunch of achievements to gain. Most of these are fairly easy to acquire, but a few can be difficult and time consuming.There is no way to save your game, so although you can "clock out" near the workshop's entrance, you won't return to the point you last left off. This isn't a huge deal, but if you've gone through the effort of meticulously cleaning Santa's workshop, you'll want to take some screenshots as it'll be a mess again when you return.I should note that "Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage" is actually a variant of a free game (technically an alpha), created by the same developer (RuneStorm), simply entitled "Viscera Cleanup Detail." Everything is the same in the free version except the setting, which is on a space station, and a lack of achievements. Something the free version has that Santa's Rampage doesn't, however, is the opportunity for online multiplayer gameplay. Whether or not this will be added to Santa's Rampage is anyone's guess. Viscera Cleanup Detail is only free right now because it's an alpha. It will cost at some point in the future, and if you pre-order it, you'll automatically get a Steam key for it, plus Steam keys for Viscera Cleanup Detail: Shadow Warrior and Santa's Rampage. The URL is here: http://www.runestorm.com/viscera So would I recommend Santa's Rampage? Yes, provided you get it on sale (I paid about two bucks) or you get it by pre-ordering the regular Viscera Cleanup Detail. There's not much of a game here, but it's a fun activity if you've got too much time to wait around, but not enough to engage in a longer, more detailed title.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
The Main PlotVarious notes and letters can be found in the workshop and office, implying that prior to the player's role in Santa's Rampage, Santa Claus had been under large amounts of stress from unpaid bills, outrageous requests from children, elf union strikes, and even threats. Santa subsequently snapped under the pressure, purchasing several crates of 12-gauge shotgun rounds, steak knives, and dynamite sticks, and fashioning several makeshift molotov cocktails (likely under the influence of alcohol). Santa then went on a murder spree, mutilating several elves and reindeer, and destroyed parts of his workshop in the process. He left the scene through unknown means.After these events, the company "Polar Sanitation Co." employed the player and sent them to clean the workshop, where the player's role in Santa's Rampage begins.For the ending of my review i can say that the developers did not do the normal online game, where each can play with friends or just a stranger who finds your game. My mark is 8/10.

Posted: March 1, 2014
												After a grueling 5-6 hours, I, along with my four other men, had finally cleaned the horrible mess. After a long determinated clean filled with pep talks and buckets galore, we had emerged victorious; covered in sweat and blood, a triumphant sigh had escaped our lips. Never again will we come near this place, this place of horror, but when we look back at our achievement, we will certainly know that we were the true gamers, the true cleaners, the true ocd freaks. This game is the truest of true bonding experience and test of friendship. However from a minor glitch of the blood that prevents gaining all achievemnents. This game is well worth the price. Recommended to play this with at least four other players.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
 Summarized Review Viscera Cleanup Detail is a great game.I Recommend this game.9/10 Full Review Just by watching the trailer, you know what you're getting yourself into.You're cleaning up dead elven entrails, nuf said.As a game made on the Unreal engine, the game itself is amazing.The graphics are better than those in skyrim, and the same thing goes for the ingame physics.On your own, this should take you about three hours to completely clean (give or take ten minutes cleaning up every time a dismembered body part flops out of your bucket dispenser).About half of the three hours you spend cleaning will be spent on stacking buckets to create a horribly engineered ladderto the clean the blood and smashed christmas ornaments off the roof.You will spend one hour cleaning blood and burning bodies, then the last half-hour trying to find a small chunk of elf flesh that has fallen behind santa's desk.If you play with friends however, this job should take just a fraction of the time you did it on your own. right?Wrong.While you try to clean, one or more of your friends will make a bigger mess by using Santa's TNT to blow you and himself up. I'm looking at you bob..That ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥gery aside. I rate this game 9/10

content:
Posted: July 4, 2015
												I love the concept of the game and I love the graphics. This game had it all to be pure gold, but unfortunately I cannot recommend this at the present time. The amount and severity of bugs make the game not enjoyable at all. Invisible dirt spots, objects getting stuck in corners or under the floor, movement glitches, janitor's box glitching in several and disastrous ways, fireplace not destroying some items no matter how long they're kept in (had to re-insert them to make it work), items going trough the buckets and disposable bins, itens flying violently all over the place when a laid down bin is put in the right position... I could also list some refinements that make gameplay better, but these glitches and bugs are way more important, and they're not being addressed so a list of improvements is unnecessary. Conclusion: Do not buy it no matter how cheap you find it.

Posted: January 4, 2014
												This game is both soothing and amazingly enraging at the same time. There is something calming about cleaning up the destruction of others, but as soon as you accidentally bump an elf head into the freshly cleaned wall which results in even more splattered blood, then you start seeing red (no pun intended). I wanted to go on a murderous rampage myself after finding out, no, leaving the game through the pause menu instead of the check out computer doesn't actually save the game. If you need to go out and get something while playing this, just leave the game running and hope it doesn't crash (it did, the second time I tried cleaning - so much rage). Hours. Hours of careful, meticulous cleaning and hoarding of elf heads wasted without even praise. It was ♥♥♥♥ing bull♥♥♥♥♥♥But still. This game is awesome and exactly what I needed after the festive season. Play this if you want to know what it feels like to have your meds fail on you.

Posted: December 23, 2015
												After 9 hours of playing and getting 100% of the achivements, I feel It's fair I put in my two cents about the game. Pros: (In no order)Never encounted one bugFun graphics Witty textPoses a fair amount of challenge Flawless gameplay Speed Run gamemode Cons:  (In no order)Somtimes must use console to get items that fall behind desks/containers Very short To dark/bright in some areas Tower of Bable achievement can be frustratingTL:DR VersionI bought the game during the Steam 2015 Holiday Sale for $1.24. The game is just a silly little standalone in the North Pole where you clean up Ol' St. Nicks slaughter of his dear workers. A great game to just pass the time with I can recommend this to anyone that wants some cheap fun. Game is completly flawless.Now for something a little more in depth.Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's RampageSanta's Rampage is a standalone of the full Viscera Cleanup Deatail. In this version you head up to the North Pole and visit Santa's Workshop. Santa has put up with his Elves long enough and has gone postal with his knives and boomstick. You gain entrance to Santa's Workshop just to be greeted with the festering corpses of Elves as well as his Reindeer. It is your job as the janitor to clean up this mess and decided the fate of Christmas. With mop in hand you go on a gut wrenching cleaning frenzy, mopping up Elf guts to properly disposing of expolsives (or not). I really had a blast collecting various toys and stacking stools (Harder than you may think) to get the 13 achivements this game has to offer. Viscera Cleanup also offers a local or online co-op mode so you can even mop with your friends. If you have an extra few dollars in your Steam Wallet I say go ahead and pick this up and give it a go, it's a good time passer.10/10 Would collect decapited Elf heads and take them back to the office again.Feel free to message me if you have questions about the review/gameThanks for reading,MonkeyWrench

Posted: December 23, 2015
												After 9 hours of playing and getting 100% of the achivements, I feel It's fair I put in my two cents about the game. Pros: (In no order)Never encounted one bugFun graphics Witty textPoses a fair amount of challenge Flawless gameplay Speed Run gamemode Cons:  (In no order)Somtimes must use console to get items that fall behind desks/containers Very short To dark/bright in some areas Tower of Bable achievement can be frustratingTL:DR VersionI bought the game during the Steam 2015 Holiday Sale for $1.24. The game is just a silly little standalone in the North Pole where you clean up Ol' St. Nicks slaughter of his dear workers. A great game to just pass the time with I can recommend this to anyone that wants some cheap fun. Game is completly flawless.Now for something a little more in depth.Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's RampageSanta's Rampage is a standalone of the full Viscera Cleanup Deatail. In this version you head up to the North Pole and visit Santa's Workshop. Santa has put up with his Elves long enough and has gone postal with his knives and boomstick. You gain entrance to Santa's Workshop just to be greeted with the festering corpses of Elves as well as his Reindeer. It is your job as the janitor to clean up this mess and decided the fate of Christmas. With mop in hand you go on a gut wrenching cleaning frenzy, mopping up Elf guts to properly disposing of expolsives (or not). I really had a blast collecting various toys and stacking stools (Harder than you may think) to get the 13 achivements this game has to offer. Viscera Cleanup also offers a local or online co-op mode so you can even mop with your friends. If you have an extra few dollars in your Steam Wallet I say go ahead and pick this up and give it a go, it's a good time passer.10/10 Would collect decapited Elf heads and take them back to the office again.Feel free to message me if you have questions about the review/gameThanks for reading,MonkeyWrench

Posted: December 16, 2013
												Ever wonder who has to clean up the blood and gibs after each level of your favorite FPS game? It's the janitor, the sanitation engineer, the industrial hygenist, and you get to step into his shoes to do just that in Viscera Cleanup Detail. The developor, RuneStorm, is working on the main game but has released this (Santa's Rampage) and Shadow Warrior mini-game versions ahead of it. Work with a mop, your hands, and a sniffer (stain and junk detector tool) and clean up the mess that, in this case, the jolly bearded guy made after drinking one too many Slack Spaniel Whiskey and Hurlington Eggnog concoctions. Watch out for the various weapons of mass destruction he left unused in his wake though.This Santa version and the Shadow Warrior version comes 'free' if you pre-purchase their main game on their website. If you purchase Shadow Warrior you get the SW version. Personally I recommend the Shadow Warrior version because it's a lot more polished and less buggy.This game is worth getting even if you later pre-order their unfinished game. Currently at least, you can always give the Steam key to your friend (it's through Humble's store). Just be prepared for the bugs.

Posted: January 9, 2016
Fun, Festive & FrustratingViscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage is not a DLC it’s a standalone festive version of the main game Viscera Cleanup Detail. It costs $2.49 and consists of 1 level (The Santa level). I played it with 1 other and the level is unique and a lot of the details allow you to build your own story as to what happened here. It's a 2 hour map for new players, took me 1.5 to clean it perfectly and 2.5 to clear EVERYTHING. There are 13 achievements that require you to beat the level at least 2-3 times in different ways which can take between 1 - 2.5 hours. I got 100% on the 10 hour mark so there is a fair bit of gameplay and challenge to be had but it becomes quite a grind and I was glad when it was all over. 6/10- Festive theme, Achievements are a grind but worth a play for any Viscera Cleanup Detail fan

Posted: December 26, 2015
												Viscara Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage was a little laggy at the start but it was worth it. At the the price of about $3 the game has suprisingly good quality and graphics for something that inexpensive. However it does take a long time to pick up   but is more fun and helpful when playing with friends on Steam that also have the game. There is lots of small details on the map that are interesting to find and some you get achievements for finding. The only problems I had with the game was the length of time the game took to complete and how sometimes the clock off button did not work. Overall I do reccomend this game and hope you enjoy it aswell!

Posted: January 18, 2014
												It's what you think it is.  You pick up body parts and throw them in a fire, then you mop up the blood from the area, then you go rinse out your mop because now it's all bloody.  Over and over, this is what you do.It's not a good game, but it's not bad either.  The core mechanics aren't hard--you pick up body parts, and clean up blood.  Sometimes you dispose of weapons or broken furniture.But there's a challenge to doing things optimally.  Do you bring a bucket to a spill or just clean up the spill and then come back to your bucket?  You can drop body parts or walk through pools of blood creating more mess that you're just going to have to clean up.  So it pays to be vigilant.There's some humor, especially in the areas that you're set to clean.  It's a lot about exploration (finding corpses in weird places under floorboards, on tops of bookshelves, with knives through their chest and pinned to a wall).  The areas would be less fun to clean a second time, but then there's achievements such as collecting all the money in a level or leaving it spotless (a hard task to accomplish).At the end of the day you'll really just doing something mindless and repetitious, and if it were hard it wouldn't be fun at all.  But the absurdity of the task, and the ease of it and the sense that you're getting something done keeps you going.

Posted: December 24, 2015
												 It's your job to clean up the mess, so clean it up you shall! Use your trusty mop, gloves, dispenser machines and sniffer tool to help you get all that blood out of the floor! You can even try and punch-out if you think you've done your job. Sandbox Gameplay - Don't want to clean? Just want to make more of a mess and play around with the physics? Go ahead!

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												I have OCD.  Not really, REALLY bad OCD, but enough that I have little mini-rituals of shaking door handles and checking every window, etc etc, before I go out or go to bed.  And even I can't imagine what kind of OCD-riddled LUNATIC would actually be able to get the achievement in this game which involves cleaning each and every inch of Santa's heavily-soiled workshop.  That's not to say it's that big a gaming area...an "open-world" game this sure as♥♥♥♥♥♥ain't, even if it is a tad sandbox-y (read: no story) for my usual tastes.  Santa's workshop is literally a handful of rooms, but man...the effort it takes to clean up even a couple of bodies and a few pools of blood...you gotta be a freakin' SAINT to have that kinda patience, let me tell ya.  Hell, it took me a few unsuccessful attempts before I was even able to plunge my blood-soaked mop into a bucket of water without spilling said bucket and having to go get a new one.  A SAINT, I tell you.  Me, I quickly gave up on such a monumental, pedantic task and set to making more of a mess and blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up.  At least that was vaguely "fun".   Look, it's a cute little (emphasis on "little", as in short, and relatively marginal) gimmick game, with an amusing and original premise (based, of all things, on a Weird Al Yankovic song - "The Night Santa Went Crazy" - or am I just making presumptions here?) which could surely never have been stretched beyond a few hours' worth of gameplay.  A quick glimpse at the screenshots and brief read of the marketing description, and if it sounds like "you", then what's a couple of bucks?  Me, I'll probably just play long enough to get a couple more achievements - the easy ones, not the one I mentioned above - then I guess maybe I'll dig it out for a half-hour every second or third December as a brief antidote to all that unbearably fake "Christmas cheer", before I inevitably tire of its limitations and muster up the will to play something more rewarding.     Consider this a RESERVED recommendation at best.  It's no masterpiece, not even for a "gimmick" game - see Little Inferno if you want an example of a game which is so very much more than it has any right to be - but it's distracting enough, for however brief a spell.  In better hands it could have admittedly been better, but really, with a title like that...what are you expecting?  Keep your expectations low, and you'll be fine.  The worse that can happen is you'll feel cheated and decide you wasted a couple of bucks and hate Christmas EVEN ♥♥♥♥ING MORE.  And there's nothing wrong with that.  If there's one thing this world needs, it's more Scrooges.  ♥♥♥♥ XMAS.Verdict: 6/10.

												It’s very hard to recommend this game, while it starts out as being fun it quickly turns into a chore to play. You may make it to the end and give yourself a well-earned pat on the back however when the time comes to clock out you might find that all the hours you just spent cleaning has been a big waste of time.Items such as buckets fall under the map making it impossible to finish the game, I found sometimes when tnt came out of the wash-o-matic I was unable to pick it up straight away leading to more frustration.Even though I was averaging 90fps I found the game extremely nauseous inducing even with the settings turned right down, this was only made worse with more blood, buckets and waste bins that were introduced into the game.Now that I have finished the game I don’t think I will ever play it again, kind of a one time play type of game only made worse by not being able to save progress.5/10

content:
Posted: February 24, 2016
												(The game was provided by Zaraki Snakenoman.  Thanks, man.)A decent experience on Steam, a janitorial simulator.  Choose to make it cleaner, dirtier, or....emptier than when you started.   Great for those who have an obsessive urge to clean up messes...or just to burn stuff.  Although the experience is decent, the replayability for it is limited unless cleaning/burning/messes are habits you'd like to satisfy.  Though, some of it can be more rewarding in real life than in the game.My complaint, however, is that there are some areas that your sniffer (a radar that picks up grime and clutter, only it works on a hot/cold system rather than a radar) reacts to, yet when you try everything, the invisible mess is still there.Definitely not worth full price.  Get it while it's on sale if you're interested in it.6/10

												The Night Santa Went Crazy by "Weird Al" YankovicListen to that song and you have an idea of what the theme of this game is.Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage is a "mini" game of Viscera Cleanup Detail (Pre-orders of Viscera Cleanup Detail will also get this game on steam).The game is in all of it's simplicity a cleaning simulator where you are a janitor tasked with cleaning up after a fire fight / massacre.I found this to be quite fun.The has multiplayer (at the time of writing in beta) so you can team up with friends to do some cleaning.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												I don't know about the actual "space station" full game, but Santa's Rampage is tremendous fun to play provided you're not put off by the macabre subject theme. Probably one of the most interesting aspects of this game is its ability to take something as disturbing as cleaning up dismembered elves and gore and makes you view it as a janitor would - as a job. Very quickly, you will stop perceiving the scene as a horrible, bloody murder and instead think about it in terms of how many buckets of water you need, what you can fit in a bio hazard box, where you need to stand so you don't track blood on the floor you just cleaned and so on. For such a simple basic concept, Santa's Rampage is very entertaining.It is, however, held back by niggling problems. There's no tutorial of any kind, for one, so you're left to guess at what any of the tools do. This is especially problematic with the "sniffer" which finds... Blood and "broken thing" I think, but I've no real idea what it racks or how it works. You're never given an explicit objective other than a very general order to clean the place up, but you can never be too sure what you're supposed to destroy, what you're supposed to keep or what anything does. Worst is the fact that success requires the cleaning of ALL stains, which can sometimes be so faint as to be invisible or in inaccessible places (the high ceiling) or behind objects. I've yet to succeed at this, and I can't figure out why for the life of me.In the end, though - for the price that the game asks, this is WELL worth buying. I would heartily recommend it. Unless you're squeamish.

												I love how these games are so strangely addicting I love the series.What you are doing:Mopping up bloodBurning or shredding bodies/body parts, trash, bins. buckets and pretty much anything you can touchDestroying evidence You are basically responsible for covering up for murders.It seems like a boring concept in some areas because you are just a janitor, but although it is time consuming when I play and look back at the clock I realize I ended up playing for hours it's very strange and a great pass time game. The Auto saves don't always work right but you can manually save using the esc key to get to the menu.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
												If you enjoy staying late to clean something up by yourself in silence, this is a fine distraction for a few hours.  It's very entertaining busy work at first, and you can get a bit carried away trying to dispose of all the gore.  But a few hours in and every new spill or hastily roasted grenade makes you groan, and you realize being trapped in a 3 room house, being told you haven't burned every last bullet or shard of glass, is less a game and more a slavery simulator.I had to exit and uninstall just to feel like I could breathe again.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2013
												Like all the Viscera Cleanup Detail games, I heartily recommend this! These guys just keep pumping out original content while polishing the main game for release. I thought this was a gag when my friends first told me about it and I'm glad I was wrong. This edition was a treat. Viscera Cleanup Detail is all about you trying to clean up someone else's mess after everything gets bloody and blown up. This time, you're going to the North Pole. Santa's workshop is a colorful wonderland and your in game radio's Christmas tunes do a good job of keeping your spirits up as you dispose of dynamite, knives, and tons of elf bodies. Oh, and lots of empty whiskey bottles.I have to touch on the cons though, before I can say what else I love about this game. Dynamite is ihe bane of this particular iteration. When Santa went crazy, he went dynamite happy. Careless handling of dynamite can toss messes way out of the reach of your mop, leading to lots of profanity and frustrations and rendering a full cleanup almost impossible. Given that the bucket machine now tosses live dynamite at you on occasion, it just feels like the devs are being unfair to the players. Of all the messes the space janitor has had to clean up, this may be the hardest. And while the warm mood lighting makes this game's setting pop with color, it also has the unfortunate side effect of making some of the lightest blood stains super hard to see, especially against the wood grains. Hopefully this might be corrected in a future version of the game, but at least your trusty sniffer still works well for finding the lost messes. Back to the pros!The gameplay VCD is known for is still here, and, like they did in the Shadow Warrior level, there are side objectives you can do as well for Steam achievements, namely tracking down all of the toy guns and officially licensed Rooks Keep action figures for your trunk. When you clock out, the punchout machine lists what souvenirs you dropped into your trunk. There are also numerous achievements for how well you cleaned. Did you manage to not break any of the delicate Christmas ornaments around the shop? Did you scorch the place clean of all holiday items? Did you throw your bucket dispenser's hat into the fire? The number of Steam achievements here gives the game some replayability beyond trying to see how fast or how messy you can clean things up.  The black humor found in the game's macabre setting is hit and miss, however; some of the fun in a new level of VCD is seeing how awful the messes are and figuring out a way to efficiently get things done. Some of the outlandish deaths and scenes you uncover work great, but I think the humor found in Santa's letters that outline his descent into booze and bullets felt like the writers were trying too hard. There are nuggets of humor but we get it when all the kids just want the latest expensive gadgets even though they behave like brats. A few letters are fine but after a while they all sound the same.The physics can get wonky still in a few places but this level still shows the level of polish that Runestorm is trying to create with their small team. Who knew that Santa going on an alcohol-fueled rampage could lead to one of the best Christmas releases ever? So what are you waiting for? Strap on your candy striped rubber gloves, grab your mop and get ready to save Christmas!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2013
												Like all the Viscera Cleanup Detail games, I heartily recommend this! These guys just keep pumping out original content while polishing the main game for release. I thought this was a gag when my friends first told me about it and I'm glad I was wrong. This edition was a treat. Viscera Cleanup Detail is all about you trying to clean up someone else's mess after everything gets bloody and blown up. This time, you're going to the North Pole. Santa's workshop is a colorful wonderland and your in game radio's Christmas tunes do a good job of keeping your spirits up as you dispose of dynamite, knives, and tons of elf bodies. Oh, and lots of empty whiskey bottles.I have to touch on the cons though, before I can say what else I love about this game. Dynamite is ihe bane of this particular iteration. When Santa went crazy, he went dynamite happy. Careless handling of dynamite can toss messes way out of the reach of your mop, leading to lots of profanity and frustrations and rendering a full cleanup almost impossible. Given that the bucket machine now tosses live dynamite at you on occasion, it just feels like the devs are being unfair to the players. Of all the messes the space janitor has had to clean up, this may be the hardest. And while the warm mood lighting makes this game's setting pop with color, it also has the unfortunate side effect of making some of the lightest blood stains super hard to see, especially against the wood grains. Hopefully this might be corrected in a future version of the game, but at least your trusty sniffer still works well for finding the lost messes. Back to the pros!The gameplay VCD is known for is still here, and, like they did in the Shadow Warrior level, there are side objectives you can do as well for Steam achievements, namely tracking down all of the toy guns and officially licensed Rooks Keep action figures for your trunk. When you clock out, the punchout machine lists what souvenirs you dropped into your trunk. There are also numerous achievements for how well you cleaned. Did you manage to not break any of the delicate Christmas ornaments around the shop? Did you scorch the place clean of all holiday items? Did you throw your bucket dispenser's hat into the fire? The number of Steam achievements here gives the game some replayability beyond trying to see how fast or how messy you can clean things up.  The black humor found in the game's macabre setting is hit and miss, however; some of the fun in a new level of VCD is seeing how awful the messes are and figuring out a way to efficiently get things done. Some of the outlandish deaths and scenes you uncover work great, but I think the humor found in Santa's letters that outline his descent into booze and bullets felt like the writers were trying too hard. There are nuggets of humor but we get it when all the kids just want the latest expensive gadgets even though they behave like brats. A few letters are fine but after a while they all sound the same.The physics can get wonky still in a few places but this level still shows the level of polish that Runestorm is trying to create with their small team. Who knew that Santa going on an alcohol-fueled rampage could lead to one of the best Christmas releases ever? So what are you waiting for? Strap on your candy striped rubber gloves, grab your mop and get ready to save Christmas!

												You spend hours and hours cleaning up Santa's bloody workshop with dead elfs everywhere. You think you're almost done then BOOM, TNT explodes out of no where and you're back to square one, and if you actually manage to clean everything up your're still no done, WHY!? YOU MAY ASK BECAUSE THERES SOME LITTLE PIECE OF DEAD ELF LODGED IN A UN REACHABLE CORNER THAT YOU CAN'T FIND AND YOU SPEND HOURS OF YOUR LIFE LOOKING FOR THIS LITTLE PIECE OF DEAD ELF BUT NEVER FIND IT AND YOU RAGE QUIT IN SHAME AND AGONY. You finally settle you're self done and get ready to go to bed reasuring your self that tomorrow is a new day and things will be different BUT GUESS WHAT IT'S NOT AND YOU'RE THROWN INTO THE EMOTIONAL ROLLERCOASTER AGAIN AND AGAIN IN A NEVER ENDING LOOP! 10/10 RECOMMEND THIS GAME

content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												This game will slowly suck your life away until you come across christmas again, and then you will be sucked into a endless loop of listening to ninja funk while cleaning up santa's workshop and seeing dead elves over and over again until you finally realize there is a thing called a life.  You will walk out into the world and find out you've been playing the game for 20 years.  And 3 years later you will become the same janitor cleaning up everything until you finally quit, massacre everyone on a space station with the help of aliens, then you will turn on the aliens and use you 2nd item and shove it up their♥♥♥♥♥until everyone on the space station is dead.  You will find yourself cleaning up the mess with your imaginary coop friend and once you clean everything up you destroy you imaginary friend with the plasma gun and findout you just shot the generator, exploding the space station while your brain fries cause of oxygen deprivation with the vaccum of space destroying your brain you remember when you were a 20 year old playing the same exact game that your living in... and right before your brain is completley gone, you remember this all started with the game called viscera cleanup detail: Santa's rampage.  Couple years later you have been revived and you find yourself shooting aliens while stopping more aliens that will destroy the human race called reapers.  You finally get to the guide system and end up sacrificing yourself to save humanity even though you have been controlled by a rogue reaper the whole time.  As darkness consumes you... you awaken in a mansion in a place called Los Santos in the state of san andreas with your wife who has been cheating on you after your yaght has been stolen and your son almost died on a freeway.  You decide to go outside and go downtown, you pull out a ak-47 and start shooting everyone you see. 1 minute later you are shot 30 times by the swat and police.  Hours later you find yourself in hong kong waiting for your friend Kane while trying to extort money from some guy, 30 minutes and 15 dead bodies later you cornor him and he slits the throat of a stripper who was being dragged by the guy following him slitting his own throat.  AHHHHHHHH @!@#!#%@%#^$@ holy !@#$!  You find out it was just a dream and you completed the game Santa's rampage.  You step outside and...you were playing that game for 20 years.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
												Visceral Cleanup is a interesting (and insane) concept with poor development  qualities.Gameplay 4/10 The game tasks you as the cleanup crew after Santa goes off the deep end. (Santa is tired of  increasing taxes, children wanting one of everything, and the tedium of being a jolly ole soul for over a millienia). What ensues is a bloody and eggnog fueled rampage from said jolly ole soul. The game has you cleaning up dead elves, reindeer, bottles of booze/eggnog, letters from a unfaithful Mrs. Claus and other bits of ridicliousness. Kudos goes to the game dev. for a orginial game and funny concept. Where the game falls flat is in the actual development .I can't be to hard on this because of two things,first this is a indie game that is still in development and second the price tag is only 2.50. For the amount of gameplay/achievements that you get the price tag isnt bad at all. But when the game will not let you complete said achievements because of  under development it can be problematic. Graphics  8/10The graphics do a good job of  dropping you into the jolly legends workshop. The happy, cheery enviroment is a stark contrast to the blood and gore  in the game. It is a very detailed (right down to tracking bloddy footprints behind you when you step in viscera). The graphics arent the best in the world but they do get the job done.Sound 8/10The sound is much the same as the graphics they  are very detailed. All of the sounds that you would expect to hear are present and accounted for, If you pick up a eviscerated elf you will hear the jingle of the bells  attached to his  shoes. This is just one example of the sound design. As a side note there is a radio that plays terrible Christmas music that...if you are anything like me...you  will quickly destroy the radio.Final NoteI can't recommend this game in its current state. The graphics,sound and gameplay all make for a interesting game. I can recommend someone  to keep a eye on this game because with more time this could be a fun  game.. Also the game is fun and very funny I enjoyed myself with it I just wish the gameplay was there a bit more,

number of helpful: 6 of 15 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
												As the title suggests, play the role of a janitor sent to clean up the aftermath of Santa's rampage through his workshop. When you first enter you'll be surprised to find just how bad the rampage was. Gameplay is pretty basic, clean up the workshop and dispose of Santa's victims to clear the game. The mop cleans up blood and soot, the tracker locates messes or objects, and your hands grab/throw things. The mop has two uses first is to clean and the other kind of acts as a mean to strike/hit objects. The tracker's blue scanner tracks nearby messes while the green tracks potential objects you need to dispose of to clear the stage in a "hot-and-cold" style. Low slow beeps when nothing is near to high rapid ones the closer you get. With your hands you can pick up just about any object or activate machines to dispense tools to help you clean.One machine will dispense water buckets used to clean your mop when it's absorbed too much filth. Another machine will produce special bins you can carry trash, items, and objects in to dispose of. Oddly enough the only way to dispose of dirty water, objects, and bins themselves is to drop it into the fireplace. Sometimes however the bucket dispenser will drop out TNT bundles or body parts which can make your task even more frustrating. It's recommended you keep a water bucket at hand to drop the TNT into as quickly as it appears to prevent it from exploding. Unfortunately this isn't information they tell you and I lost count how many times I had to flee from the room to prevent getting blown up. Adding insult to injury you then have to clean up the mess left behind.The bins can be equally frustrating. Meant to make your task easier they can also make it tedious. Objects are easily knocked around and if you bump into the bin from the wrong angle expect it to tip over. They do give you the ability to rotate things back to a standing position via grabbing and using the activation button. However if you have anything in that bin expect it to go flying all over the room. I must have knocked over the same bin at least a dozen times or had to clean it up again because the objects went flying. For the most part if you fill it right and properly grab the bin it remains fairly sturdy when moving it around. So they do have some use.Now the biggest annoyance has to be the messes themselves. Even after playing for a few hours, scouring every spot I could find there were still hidden spots I couldn't and choosing to "Clock-Out" would deem an automatic failure. A tiny invisible splotch of blood you can't see, a smudge from an explosion. The tiny bulbs that hang on the tree and garland count as messes too if they leave a colored paint splatter upon breaking. Sometimes this can be on the ceiling out of reach because a stick of TNT went off. Only way to reach them requires cheating. Due to bugs the mess you need to mop up might be hidden under the floor preventing you from finding it too. The tracker is little help since it doesn't specifically show what you missed. So again in this case you may need to resort to using the "KillNearbyMess" command to clear it. Currently the game is still in a beta-like stage so hopefully this will be fixed in later patches.Overall the game is a novelty and can be fun if you only want to cause mayhem, especially for the price. But after you've beaten it (There's only the workshop.) then that's it, after all that you won't likely play it again. Tossing dead elves around or blowing things up with the TNT can only entertain for so long. If you have a friend who's already bought the game, try it out for yourself before you buy. In the long run there's other games that can offer more replayability than this. Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage for the price is pretty good, but frustrations and having to resort to cheating just to clear it prevents me from giving a recommendation for now.

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
												Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage ReviewI first found out about this game from my friend. He really enjoys the game and I think has put at least 50 hours into it. I write a review after 10 hours of playtime unless I can't stand it. I've wanted Santa's Rampage for a long time and I finally got it. The controls work most of the time, random times when carrying buckets and elf body parts fall for no reason is really fustrating. The graphics are fantastic. A full on 10 for that. It may not be a FarCry landscape but they are not bad graphics. Being a janitor in a game... what the hell? Who wants to play that? It's first-person. You mop up stuff, YOU MOP UP SANTA'S WORKSHOP. The fire-place is your main place to go, that's where you put the Elf parts that cause blood and all the extra items you want out of the area. You use the mop the most, cleaning up blood, booze, weird ornament ooze? You also have your bare hands where you can pick up elf parts and buckets and cans and all this stuff. The next thing is this weird radar that still to this day, I don't know what it does so to me, it's useless. Now to actually start my review.You basically have 5 rooms, each time you play the game with a new job to clean, it's randomly generated blood and gore. It's just you. The easter eggs are a great part of this game and without giving too much away, finding the floor boards and rudolf's nose. Cleaning with the mop is very easy and very fun to do, you will have to dip it into the bucket multiple times which gets dirty and then you need to get a new bucket. This is actually a pretty fun concept until it's greatly overused. There's an achievement for cleaning the whole workshop and I put 4 hours into it trying to do it, ending up at the end not getting it because an ornament was stuck behind a plant. That's pretty fustrating. The greatest sense of accomplisment at ALL in this game is cleaning each room and completely finishing it. What I find pretty cool is at the beginning you can get a BRAND-NEW generated character, find out the age and backstory... BUT IT HAS NO MEANING WHAT-SO-EVER. I don't expect Viscera Cleanup Detail to have a story-line but it's the same game but in Santa's Workshop. There is one way you can die and that's blowing yourself up with TNT which half the time isn't throwable so you can't choose to die... you do it anyway. You can find Santa's shotgun and pistols but nope, you can't shoot them. I'm not expecting them to be able to shoot but it would have been a cool easteregg. This game is $2.49 and that's a pretty good deal but not entirely for this game, I'm sorry. You don't have much workspace and it's close-corredored. You are a guy but it doesn't matter who you are because it has no meaning. Most of the achievements and controls don't work and the stupid radar thing isn't useful. There's no tutorial so you have to find out how to do stuff, throws you right into it.Multiplayer is a joke and I hate saying it. My friend and I played it once using IP addresses. You have to download this stupid program to get your stupid IP address to play, how would you know that? Besides, even with a PING on both sides of 20, it's super laggy and with your resolution down. Also, did I mention the game is not full-screen unless you set it to be full? The only time when it's not laggy is when you're using your mop or hands and not moving around. There is a jump function, what do you need it for? There's one game mode, there's not even a game mode... you clean. < That I don't complain about because it's fun for an hour and that's about it. Let me say what I like about it (unfortuantely, it's not a lot) the graphics are really cartoony and cool. It's something fresh that a 60 dollar game doesn't really have. The backstory and name's and ages of characters before play is cool even if there's no follow-up to it. Clocking out is feeling legit even if it's a 2-second thing. Using the mop is a blast for a bit, it's something new. Making it first-person is super cool. Finding the easter eggs is pretty sweet. Making a bigger mess and clocking off like a terrible guy at his job makes getting the achievement for it so much sweeter.Unfortauntely, this is my first game that uh... I like and don't like. Even for $2.49 which may seem good, the game is not worth the money. It's about an hour's worth of gameplay if you weren't going for achievements and easter eggs. Otherwise, you get about 10 hours of playtime like me. Multiplayer sucks, fix it and don't use IP addresses. Give us a tutorial, if it weren't for my friend... I don't think that I would've gotten very far into the game without getting fustrated. Controls are 50/50, mop works the best out of everything. Easter-eggs don't do anything (shotgun and pistols) and same with character development. You know what I would've wanted to see maybe at one point like when YOU COMPLETELY CLEAN THE PLACE and about to clock-off... Santa comes. If the game was about a dollar or maybe even free-to-play it would be worth it, but in my opinion and I love the original Viscera Cleanup Detail and hope to see more, Santa's Rampage isn't worth it and it may get a couple laughs out of you but you won't last more than an hour unless you find a way to. Check the floorboards upstairs and remove them, you get a surprise inside. -Detroit0127

content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												In all, this is a good game. Let me start at the beginning.      Viscera Cleanup Detail started as a standalone mini-game for Shadow Warrior. While it was boring cleaning up dead guys, the gore shocked most. Now in this edition, apparantly Santa got pressured by elves, dumb wish lists, and reindeer crap. He took a shotgun, a knife, and rage, and killed everyone. While this is disturbing for those young Steamers out there, once again, the gore shocked most into playing it repeatedly. The game features those surgeon simulator graphics, so it wasn't realistic. However, the graphics mean nothing. The only thing that caught players' attentions, was the shocking aftermath and story. So in conclusion, the cleaning is boring for most, but the fact that Santa melted under pressure shocked players into enduring @#$! to clean it all up!

number of helpful: 9 of 28 people (32%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												Seemed like it could be a cool little game to mess with for $2. Didn't take long to lose interest and uninstall. For starters, it throws you into the game without directions. Once I looked at the control setup in the options menu I was able to figure out that I needed to get buckets and disposal bins from the machines. Just throwing that on the screen upfront would have been nice. Then the mopping. You get like 3 swipes of the mop before it starts splashing blood everywhere making a bigger mess than the 3 swipes you cleaned up. While this may increase realness, it also sucks the fun out of it. And I kept knocking over the water bucket whenever I went to dip it. Is it really necessary to make the water bucket fall over that easily? It's just so tedious. I couldn't imagine it being fun in any way after realizing I'd need to clean my mop every 3 swipes. And you leave footprints everywhere any time you step in blood and well, there's blood everywhere. Hard not to step in it. And the first person view makes it hard to see what is directly below you. And if your mop starts throwing blood around, it seems a surefire way to get it on your shoes. I'm sure if you have patience for this game to move at a very slow methodical pace, taking inch by inch, you could probably master what the game expects. I don't know about other players, but I don't really want to spend hours dipping my mop and cleaning up my shoes. It's just unappealing.There are a lot of setting options. I had to adjust resolution, toggle off window mode, adjust field of vision and mouse sensitivity, and toggle off head bob. So it's nice the options are all there to customize, but it still made me nauseated playing.

Posted: January 3, 2014
 Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage. Welp... It finally happened. Jolly ol´ Saint Nick burnt out and snapped. And Bloody hell! Did he leave a mess....Several poor elves wont be returning to their families today, aye it´s a sad day for North Pole. Well if you played any other Cleanup Detail game, this is pretty much the same as the previous.Guts to cleanup, bodyparts to bin and buckets of blood to mop of the floor...And the game is about as buggy as any other instalment in the "series".  HARGH!  Sorry.. I just cant call a game a series if its the same thing over and again..  CoD joke removed, due to me not wanting to deal with caffeinated preschoolers. ANY-WAYS TO WEEKEND!The game is still a buggy pile of  FUN, didn't see that coming did ya ? , and yet even if its pretty much a janitor simulator.  And i just removed 5 very offense and very, very sensitive subject jokes, don't hate me. And i really should not drink this much coffee when i've only had under 6 hours of sleep. Might make me a bit erratic.

Posted: March 3, 2014
												This game is much more fun than it should be (now with much loved save function!) There's something satisfying about burning elf bodies in the fire and seeing the bloody mess wash away under your mop. Then again, it's also just as much fun to throw elf parts into a trunk and use all the leftover molotovs and dynamite to blow up what's still standing.  The "story" can be found in letters that you find, and all the flavor text and details just add to the experience. I clean more in this game than I clean in real life, and that's ok. Worth picking up, and I will definately be picking up the other Viscera Cleanup Detail games in the future!

Posted: October 30, 2015
												Santa is done.Santa took matters into his own hands and even Krampus is scared.Its VCD with a Christmas undertone, and clearly, Santa was a heavy drinker. Its actually tons of fun to break the bottles of whiskey and eggnog, and blow up the TNT to only kill yourself.Its a great spinoff 8/10

Posted: October 29, 2015
												If you like messing around in "real" games for hours-on-end after you've already beaten them, then VCD may be entertaining for you. It's like unlocking an "anti game" play mode in a serious FPS where you get to totally go against the normal play style.If you like to just play an FPS game, beat it, then move on to the next challenge... VCD will probably bore you to tears.Essentially, you'll either love or hate VCD. There's not too much middle ground.Santa's Rampage was an interesting entry in the VCD experience, but, once again, they didn't really tap any potential beyond what normal VCD provides. No exploration, no secrets, no puzzles... just cleaning.I know VCD revolves around cleaning, but I view VCD in the same vein as the Thief series of games. You have a primary game-play aspect, but certain levels and things had you solving mysteries and messing around with other stuff as a secondary aspect. VCD needs to really tap into this potential if it wants to grow beyond "cleaning simulator" status.The stage is entertaining, but you end up with dynamite that doesn't seem to serve a purpose other then make a mess when incinerated (unless you know how to properly dispose of it). The slaughter was funny to look at. There's a few gimicky secrets (eg: the painting that tosses x-mas balls when you whack it).But, it's mostly just x-mas themed VCD. I know, that's what you would expect. But, I think they could have done more with this. I still recommend it, though.

Posted: October 7, 2015
												It's a decent game with good graphics but the game gets repetitive and bland very quickly, UNLESS you have a friend along for the ride. Playing co-op makes it a completely different game, you will mostly mess around and blow each other up with dynamite but that's what makes the experience truely memorable. So i do recommend this game if you have friend(s) to play it with.

Posted: March 19, 2016
												If you ever want to just clean stuff, you just play this game.The game itself is more of a one time play-through, but there is satisfaction to be found in discovering the little secrets that the achievements point out. I do wish there was a bonus type level after you actually finish cleaning the whole place.It's a very detailed process. You clean the mop, you clean a bloody spot, you re-clean your mop, and your bucket gets dirtier. Rinse, repeat, Victory! It is simple to understand, but just a silly process.It's definitely a fun little game, and I would recommend this game :)

Clean the place up to earn a paycheque or make a bigger mess to prove how much you love your job........i don't think we even get paid for cleaning so why not trash the place. 3. Listen to some music while your cleaning4. Find guts and other body parts fly out of your equipment5. Find all the guns and store them in your lunch box....you know for security....Viscera Clean Up detail has brought another fun short mission for you to clean with your friends or by yourself but I would strongly recommend with friends :D. If you like cleaning or something to just play around with, pick up Viscera Cleanup and enjoy your cleaning adventures.
