There are a couple of suggestions I do have for this game but highly doubt these will happen considering this was one of the 1st games this developer has made and has made such an improvement! Anyway my suggestions:1) THOSE DAMN BLOODY BUCKETS! I know I'm not the only one who has droped  a bloody bucket making more of a mess then I'd started with. If that could be disabled I will be very very very very very very very very happy.2) If there was an option to join a random game with players already in it instead of having to enter a password that would be cool too and a lot easier.Thanks for reading my Review and hope you get the game!

Grade: 72/100Difficulty: Awkward controls, which adds to the mess and makes it a challenge to complete some of the goals.Pros: Lets you vent your displeasure of the holiday season in a 'fun' way. Co-op makes it more entertaining.Cons: Could have more content. The music is aggravating as hell. Physics are overly wonky/sensitive which complicates a few game elements.Replayable: At least until you get sick of making a bloody mess. Or finish all the achievements.

												As a mature woman occsaional gamer, I found this game to be a blast.  Nothing can kill you, nothing jumps out at you, and the surprises are just funny ones. My only complaint was that I could not finish the game completely because I couldn't fly so had to leave the stains on the ceiling.  But this is a well done, humorous, relaxing game to play.  I can't wait to try the other games in this series.

Posted: April 11, 2015
												Santa's Rampage is a small "spin-off" of Viscera Cleanup Detail, having only one-level with special theme to it. It also has engine updating alongside with big main game, multiplayer is working just fine as well. Physics on other hand...And yes, Unreal Engine 3. Whoop.You can say that this game is a FPS physics-driven game, as your main job is to clean up the place, cleaning blood and ashes off and burning down all the remains of Santa's insanity, aside from knifes. Knifes are important part of XMas. And you have to do that with brush, hands that apparently grow from butt, non-reliable mess-detecting device and machines that dispence buckets of water, contrainer and surprises. Oh, and fireplace. And listening to radio for music. Which you can burn as well. And having to figure out how to burn explosives safely.Well, or at least you have to clean it all up on theory, for the game doesn't require you to do that. You can finish the level anytime, it will just tell you to what kind of state the level fits (Cleaned, burned EVERYTHING or made even bigger mess), a game got few achievements on those. The level is quite detailed and it's fun to read Santa's letter and see what rampage left us with.Some achievements are very hard, I must say.And main idea of a game is that there is a lot of things that can go wrong, a mess can get even bigger by accident, and you have to handle all the incoming sudden problems up. Heck, you can just knock a bucket full of blood by accident and then leave bloody footprints all over the place. Giving you all the challenge in this game which lacks classic enemies. Though you still should have a love for chores and cleaning to begin with.Yet the game has big flaw. This physics-based game has a flaw, and a flaw comes from...physics. It's buggy. Stuff can clip through the floor or wall. Most often it can be thrown out by explosives. It doesn't feel good when you do a hour-long cleaning and then to find nothing left, because at one point you had explosion that threw something under level. You can still use cheats to clean the nearest mess. But it's not good either, as you are still unsure if game glitched or you just didn't notice something yet.And even if you ignore glitches, those hanging XMas balls are evil. If something explodes, chances are, they will be sent onto ceiling, breaking and leaving mess there. And it's very hard to reach such places, in hall, especially when playing alone. In this case you will have to build a ladder of stools, which is unrelaible, tedius and you may decided to burn all of them before, who knows.Flaws like these to ruin the enjoyment, if you want to properly and fairly clean the place, then you must be pretty much perfect from start. No fun from cleaning and fully fixing your own mess, as you are pretty much screwed from this point. Bai bai, proper cleaning achievement and message.This game also supports coop play with other players over Internet. Yes, you can respawn infinitively, in single-player mode too. So with a pair of friends it becomes pure joy and chaos. I recommend to play in this mode, even better as a first impression!So yes, I can still recommend this game, even if flawed. For sake of fun with friends. And a bit of cleaning chore love. It's an unique game, after all. Well, more like, a spin-off of a main unique game.I just hope that main Viscera Cleanup will be less frustation, at least it will not have XMas balls all over the place.

												Ever wanted to know what it feels like to carry a bucket of elf guts, and reindeer pieces? Well now you can!*Gameplay*+ Only fun you'll have cleaning up, ever+ Lots of variety in messes- Repetitive- Frustrating when you can't find that one little spot to get 100%- Only one map, so little replayability*Graphics*+ Cute, cartoon looking+ Bloody, gory, and perfect example of a Santa rampage- Glitches every so often, causes frustration- Unable to pick up some objects due to glitches*Story*+ Cute little notes to Santa Claus+ Not all are so "cute" or "innocent"- No story besides Santa was in a bad mood+ No story really needed*Overall*Fun game, but has little to come back for after a couple hours. Only one map so you clean it up once fully, then destroy it as much as possible and that's.... well that's sort of it... Much better with friends though.Pick it up on sale (even though $3 is a reasonable price) for a few hours of entertainment.

Posted: October 29, 2015
												If you like messing around in "real" games for hours-on-end after you've already beaten them, then VCD may be entertaining for you. It's like unlocking an "anti game" play mode in a serious FPS where you get to totally go against the normal play style.If you like to just play an FPS game, beat it, then move on to the next challenge... VCD will probably bore you to tears.Essentially, you'll either love or hate VCD. There's not too much middle ground.Santa's Rampage was an interesting entry in the VCD experience, but, once again, they didn't really tap any potential beyond what normal VCD provides. No exploration, no secrets, no puzzles... just cleaning.I know VCD revolves around cleaning, but I view VCD in the same vein as the Thief series of games. You have a primary game-play aspect, but certain levels and things had you solving mysteries and messing around with other stuff as a secondary aspect. VCD needs to really tap into this potential if it wants to grow beyond "cleaning simulator" status.The stage is entertaining, but you end up with dynamite that doesn't seem to serve a purpose other then make a mess when incinerated (unless you know how to properly dispose of it). The slaughter was funny to look at. There's a few gimicky secrets (eg: the painting that tosses x-mas balls when you whack it).But, it's mostly just x-mas themed VCD. I know, that's what you would expect. But, I think they could have done more with this. I still recommend it, though.

Posted: December 14, 2013
												I have been looking for a morbid Christmas game since the Santa Slayer demo, about 10 or more years ago, and this was pretty much what I'm looking for. Almost like a sequal to it honestly, since Santa goes on a rampage. The only difference is, you're the one cleaning up, instead of killing...or you can make a mess.It's a pretty straight forward game, and not too fancy. You can make the mess way worse, sometimes without trying if you're not careful. Getting rid of the elf bodies takes some time, due to having to maneuver them to the bucket, without getting blood everywhere. I just got to the point where I burned them in the fireplace which excited me a bit too much. All in all, for the price, I think it's pretty fun.

Posted: January 27, 2014
												"A game where you clean, how can this be any fun?". No idea why, but it is!You, alone or with friends, enters Santa's workshop after his breakdown. Its a complete mess. As a cleaner, your duty is to make the place look nice and tidy. But, there is more to it than that. You can choose to despose all the blood and gore or make more! Having this free will to do what you want makes the game so much more fun. And for some weird reason, if you choose to clean up Santa's Workshop it gives you a weirdly rewarding feeling.There are some negative sides to the game. It feels kinda small and you can get tired of it, that depends on your imagination. But all in all, its not very expensive and decent game, so i recomend it.

Posted: September 7, 2014
												VCD: Santa's Rampage is a rather odd game, I picked it up from ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cheap. Best amount of money I have ever spent, this is a Niche title, meaning there is nothing else like it anywhere, apart from Real Life....Being a Human Male, I despize Cleaning and everything that Women are supposed to do in the house. But this, this makes Cleaning bloomin' hilariousFirstly you are told to Clean the Workshop, simple enough. But then comes the fun part. Being able to smear dead Elves all over the walls and showing them how to Paint the Town Red. You can also Blow Up Dynamite....and Molotovs. Which is ♥♥♥♥ING annoying. As the game progresses you start to feel sympathy for the people who did bad in their GCSE's and A-Level and are now Minimum Wage paid Janitors. But...you know, Elf Body Parts. The Fun thing is the Collectables. You can slap them in your Janitor's chest and hey presto! Easy Achievements. The other fun thing is the Elf Body Parts....didn't I mention that already? One of the main bad things in this entire game, IS THE MOP BUCKETS. Knocking these ♥♥♥♥ers over is like having to ask Valve to release Half-Life 3. Never going to happen. The other bad thing is the Knives. Sometimes they get stuck UNDERNEATH the floor. You have to cheat. To complete the game...sometimes. Frustration is the main aspect of this game. In Conclusion. Best Woman Housework Simulator 2014. 11/10

Posted: February 7, 2015
												SPOILERS!I suggest you have a powerful hardrive, because this game will go to 23 frames a second if you don't. Anyway, this game isnt as fully featured as its cousins in the Viscera series. It lacks voice and only has one small map, which has enough junk to fill up two maps. I recommend this game if you enjoyed the others in the series (in this time period, the trilogy). You clean up after Santa has had it, seeing letters found through-out the game show he was in massive debt and kids are just plain annoying and demmanding. Cleanup Santas work area, throw out raindeer carcas, remove elf bodies from the premisis, and most annoying of all, get rid of TNT without killing yourself (Tip: its a very short timer).I give it 3 stars, and it's a great way to pass the time.

												Scrub-a-dub-dub, three elf heads in a tub. If you aren't easily offended and have a sense of humor, this is a great game. If you are OCD, this is a great game. Clean blood, dispose of body parts. Simple. Fun. Time consuming. What more could you want?I recommend this game, because the humor and fun value I had playing it far outweighed my general $1/hour of gameplay required rule. Granted, I ended up playing it a second time with another friend, so I guess I did get more than the full value out of it, but I wouldn't expect to be playing this for more than an hour, so judge that how you will. If you buy Shadow Warrior, you get the Shadow Warrior version of it, which is better value, imo. The base game is also $8 base and is still being developed, with presumably multiple levels, unlike this one, so that might be the best bet. You can still pick this one up for cheap and see if you like it though.

Posted: September 1, 2014
												The Holiday pressures have finally gotten to Santa--He's finally vented all those pent-up frustrations. Unfortunately for the elves, Santa wasn't to particular about who he took it out on! It's your job to put things to rights and boy, do you have job security! This one is a toughie. Lots of bodies, buckets of blood, and you'll need to be creative to reach those hard--to-reach places.  On the up side, you've got lots of bins to put trash in and lots of buckets of water so you can mop everything until they shine.... but every so often, if you are lucky, you will be given bloody body parts instead of a bin or a bucket of water. I say "lucky" because the alternative is a bundle of TNT and a lit fuse! Oh, and you might want to think about how you dispose of the sticks of dynamite and those "cocktails" Santa put together. You wouldn't want it to blow up in your face! Yeah, this one is a definite challange, with a Christmas theme for those of you who wish Christmas would never end!

Posted: December 18, 2013
												Menial fun. That about sums up VCD: Santa's Rampage pretty well. There is a mess and you must clean it up. It's not 'fun' as in there's something to explore, or learn, or kill... But there is fun here. I find it only fitting that, after killing myriads of enemies myself, I am now the janitor cleaning up after someone else's mess. The dynamite adds a bit of excitement. However, the lack of voice acting really hinders the immersion. VCD: Shadow Warrior kept me playing because of the voiced humor. This title's janitor is silent. Also, there is bugs! I spent 2 hours cleaning the place to find out some objects had fallen through the floor, meaning I was not able to clock out and get my achievment. And that's what VCD is really all about, for me, achievments! No, the game isn't really all that fun, but it's not too terribly difficult to get all the achievments. This isn't a bad title either if you had a laptop that can run it, and your signifigant other forces you to sit and watch Glee or Scandal or Revenge (yes, this happens to me). For less than $2 VCD: Santa's Rampage is a good deal.

Posted: August 4, 2014
												I've had the pleasure of having the full Viscera package gifted to me, and I cherish this game a lot.Currently, I play Car Mechanic Simulator and KAMI when I want to relieve some stress and just relax. Viscera easily fits with those games (most of the time).The aesthetics are fantastic, the detail in Santa's Workshop is very well-done, and the blood splatter, various Elf bodies in random levels of dismemberment add to the grim atmosphere that you must attempt to clean up. The music and sounds are appropriate to the scenario - Christmas-themed, but still enough to get you a little pumped to do some hardcore cleaning. Also, if you would rather play without music, you can always pick up the radio and toss it in the fireplace (along with a piece of dynamite or two for good measure) The overall mess in the workshop is great, as you can walk around and recreate the carnage unleashed by Santa in your head. The controls are fairly straightforward, and playing will be easy if you've started with the original Viscera before this one. You can switch between three items - your hands for manipulating objects, your mop, and the sniffer (which lets you know if you've missed anything in your cleaning routine). When you pick up items, you can click the mouse to orient them in a default position (ex: elf bodies will be held up straight, making it easier to place them into the containers). The learning curve is minimal, since all you need to do is clean up the workshop; however, obtaining 100% achievement completion may take some extra work (and honestly some internet research since a few are very specific with a tiny window for error).The gameplay - for me at least - is very calming. You need to interact with two janitor machines - one provides you with buckets of water, while the other provides you with a hazardous waste container. The bucket creator will sometimes give you random elf body parts, potentially adding more mess to the immediate area.When you mop up blood, you get several wipes before your mop is too soaked, rendering it ineffective (mopping any surface will simply spread more blood). You will then have to wipe your mop in the water bucket (which can be used a total of 4 times before you need to get a new one). Note: the collision mechanics in this game are extremely sensitive (which I think they were going for), and you can accidentally tip over the bucket, splashing bloody gore all over the place. That being said, absolutely nothing is stopping you from doing a reverse-Cleanup Detail and spreading blood all over the place (as I am doing right now).I'm not crazy. Maybe just a tad bit.The hazardous waste container helps you collect the elf body parts, debris, and other junk. You can then carry them over to the fireplace to destroy them (the containers can also be destroyed if you leave them there). You can manually carry each item to the fireplace, however, since you can only hold one item at a time, this would take much longer. Be advised, since the collision mechanics are very sensitive, it is very, very easy to accidentally spill the contents of your container all over the place. If any elf body parts rubs against a surface, there is a very high chance it will spread blood all over the place.There is also a janitor lockbox where you can depost things like Santa's shotgun and other weapons. Be WARNED, the box seems to be extremely buggy (I call it Pandora's box), and I strongly recommend you DO NOT try to move it - you should even avoid trying to open/close it too much. I tried to move the box, and it propelled me all over the workshop. I learned my lesson and have no left it there every time.There is a fair amount of detail in the level, and you can even pick up and read some of the letters to Santa - some of which are pretty hilarious.While I was in my relaxing trance, I had a nice setup going - bloody buckets organized in clear areas, along with waste containers ready to be placed into the fireplace. I was not sure what to do with the assortment of dynamite sticks, so I dropped them into the bloody water buckets and placed everything in the fireplace. I picked up a nearby container and moved to place it inside as well.The dynamite promptly blew up, spreading blood and gore everywhere, and eradicating me instantly.I waited, and laughed when I respawned - I was given a briefing mentioning the incompetence of the previous janitor, with a note that I might possibly be promoted to full-time janitor if I did a good job (you can keep killing yourself).A really, really fun game. Check it out if you are interested at all.Highly recommend!If you like this review, please consider checking out DJSF's Rogue Reviews Steam Group for more in-depth reviews

Posted: January 19, 2014
												I'm not going to lie, the workshop is a bloody mess. Mutilated elves and raindeer are found sticking to the walls and ceiling, with blood smeared all over the place. There are notes found in Santa's office and the platform upstairs detailing the back story before the masacure took place. Apparently he was being hit with hefty fines, which got to a point where he couldn't pay off his debts. On top of that he received notes from naughty children, who wanted specific things fromg him so they could do naughty things. There's also a note where Santa's wife, Mrs. Clause, stating that he was leaving him. The final note was apparently a receipt detailing the list of weaponry he bought.You'll have to remove the items on said receipt, basically burn them all in the fireplace, along with the dismemebered body parts of workers and raindeer. Every smudge, bloodstain, and soot must be cleaned from the workshop in order to get the achievement for cleaning up the mess. What you do after that is up to you.TL;DR:Awesome game, makes me wanna clean up my house.

Posted: April 18, 2014
												I picked up this game because my friend told me to and because the reviews were hilarious.I absolutely love this. Repeatedly pressing left click just to mop is actually alot of fun, and moving elf body parts to Santa's fire to burn them. It's hilarious knocking over your friend's bucket filled with blood right after he finished cleaning or accidentally blowing him up with dynamite and creating a big, gorey mess that you both to clean up, only to fling one of his arms behind a table to be found later. Finding Rudolf's nose, elf corpses used as throwing knife targets, letters to Santa, and even empty Jack Daniels rip off bottles called "Spack Spaniels" are hilarious little details. The writing is also hilarious, from the bios of your employee records to the spoiled kids sending letters to Santa. I really suggest getting this game because it's hilarious.

Posted: August 4, 2014
												I've had the pleasure of having the full Viscera package gifted to me, and I cherish this game a lot.Currently, I play Car Mechanic Simulator and KAMI when I want to relieve some stress and just relax. Viscera easily fits with those games (most of the time).The aesthetics are fantastic, the detail in Santa's Workshop is very well-done, and the blood splatter, various Elf bodies in random levels of dismemberment add to the grim atmosphere that you must attempt to clean up. The music and sounds are appropriate to the scenario - Christmas-themed, but still enough to get you a little pumped to do some hardcore cleaning. Also, if you would rather play without music, you can always pick up the radio and toss it in the fireplace (along with a piece of dynamite or two for good measure) The overall mess in the workshop is great, as you can walk around and recreate the carnage unleashed by Santa in your head. The controls are fairly straightforward, and playing will be easy if you've started with the original Viscera before this one. You can switch between three items - your hands for manipulating objects, your mop, and the sniffer (which lets you know if you've missed anything in your cleaning routine). When you pick up items, you can click the mouse to orient them in a default position (ex: elf bodies will be held up straight, making it easier to place them into the containers). The learning curve is minimal, since all you need to do is clean up the workshop; however, obtaining 100% achievement completion may take some extra work (and honestly some internet research since a few are very specific with a tiny window for error).The gameplay - for me at least - is very calming. You need to interact with two janitor machines - one provides you with buckets of water, while the other provides you with a hazardous waste container. The bucket creator will sometimes give you random elf body parts, potentially adding more mess to the immediate area.When you mop up blood, you get several wipes before your mop is too soaked, rendering it ineffective (mopping any surface will simply spread more blood). You will then have to wipe your mop in the water bucket (which can be used a total of 4 times before you need to get a new one). Note: the collision mechanics in this game are extremely sensitive (which I think they were going for), and you can accidentally tip over the bucket, splashing bloody gore all over the place. That being said, absolutely nothing is stopping you from doing a reverse-Cleanup Detail and spreading blood all over the place (as I am doing right now).I'm not crazy. Maybe just a tad bit.The hazardous waste container helps you collect the elf body parts, debris, and other junk. You can then carry them over to the fireplace to destroy them (the containers can also be destroyed if you leave them there). You can manually carry each item to the fireplace, however, since you can only hold one item at a time, this would take much longer. Be advised, since the collision mechanics are very sensitive, it is very, very easy to accidentally spill the contents of your container all over the place. If any elf body parts rubs against a surface, there is a very high chance it will spread blood all over the place.There is also a janitor lockbox where you can depost things like Santa's shotgun and other weapons. Be WARNED, the box seems to be extremely buggy (I call it Pandora's box), and I strongly recommend you DO NOT try to move it - you should even avoid trying to open/close it too much. I tried to move the box, and it propelled me all over the workshop. I learned my lesson and have no left it there every time.There is a fair amount of detail in the level, and you can even pick up and read some of the letters to Santa - some of which are pretty hilarious.While I was in my relaxing trance, I had a nice setup going - bloody buckets organized in clear areas, along with waste containers ready to be placed into the fireplace. I was not sure what to do with the assortment of dynamite sticks, so I dropped them into the bloody water buckets and placed everything in the fireplace. I picked up a nearby container and moved to place it inside as well.The dynamite promptly blew up, spreading blood and gore everywhere, and eradicating me instantly.I waited, and laughed when I respawned - I was given a briefing mentioning the incompetence of the previous janitor, with a note that I might possibly be promoted to full-time janitor if I did a good job (you can keep killing yourself).A really, really fun game. Check it out if you are interested at all.Highly recommend!If you like this review, please consider checking out DJSF's Rogue Reviews Steam Group for more in-depth reviews

Posted: December 28, 2014
												A darkly humorous little physics playground where you must clean up after Santa has finally had enough and snapped. Slowly the tale of a man who's taken too much, burdened by impossible bills, a deadbeat brother, and elf union activism, comes to light. Armed with a shotgun, knives, explosives, and way, way too much whiskey, Santa has laid terrible waste to his own workshop.And it's your job to fish pieces of elves out of the craziest places and throw them in the fire, while flailing with your mop at the bloodstains *everywhere*. And trying not to break any Christmas presents. Only to set off a leftover molotov cocktail by accident...Worth the buck I paid for it.7/10 provides scientific proof that I am far too easily entertained

Posted: December 28, 2014
												Scrub-a-dub-dub, three elf heads in a tub. If you aren't easily offended and have a sense of humor, this is a great game. If you are OCD, this is a great game. Clean blood, dispose of body parts. Simple. Fun. Time consuming. What more could you want?I recommend this game, because the humor and fun value I had playing it far outweighed my general $1/hour of gameplay required rule. Granted, I ended up playing it a second time with another friend, so I guess I did get more than the full value out of it, but I wouldn't expect to be playing this for more than an hour, so judge that how you will. If you buy Shadow Warrior, you get the Shadow Warrior version of it, which is better value, imo. The base game is also $8 base and is still being developed, with presumably multiple levels, unlike this one, so that might be the best bet. You can still pick this one up for cheap and see if you like it though.

Posted: July 3, 2016
												I got this game on sale quite a while ago, played it with my sister and it was fun but it got tiring after a bit. It is a very unique idea: Santa went on a rampage and destoryed the house and made a very large mess, and you have to clean it up. If you've got a friend you want to play with, give it a shot and you'll have fun for a few hours. Solo it can get pretty boring and I'm not sure if that's worth it. Really the only bad thing game play wise is that it does glitch some of the containers sometimes and everything you picked up gets thrown out around the room, and sometimes something that you need to clean gets glitched out of the map so you can never get 100% competed game. Unless you really do require getting 100% though it's not completely necessary to do that go have a good time with it.I'd say as long as you know what you're going into: a cleanup game without and story, just picking up bits and pieces and trashing them, then you'll enjoy it.

Posted: December 24, 2013
												For those who haven't had a chance to play any variation of this glorious game, now is a better time than any. Besides the original alpha (which is still up for download on the dev's website) this is the only official independent release of the game. There was one that came with Shadow Warrior as well, and I can imagine that one is just as fun.First of all, yes, this game is a joke. That's the point. It's witty, it's sarcastic, the concept is amazingly silly, but it's an extraordinary amount of fun. For a game that may as well have been titled "Janitor Simulator 2013", I think this game has given me more pleasure for $2.49 than at least half the big brand games out there have on sale.Don't get me wrong. This is a fairly one and one kind of game. I'm not saying the appeal will last forever. But with it's 13 achievements and cheap sale price, you can get at least 3 or 4 hours of fun out of this game. Not only that, but supporting it means you're providing the funds for the developers to keep making more. As we've already seen with Shadow Warrior, this medium provides the potential for dozens of parodies.Viscera Cleanup Detail runs on the Unreal Engine 3, which means that any of game running on the Unreal Engine 3 has the potential of being ported easily for this game. This list includes, but is not limited to: Bioshock Infinite, Alice: Madness Returns, Borderlands 1 & 2, Deadpool, Dishonored, Devil May Cry, Mass Effect, Sanctum, Section 8, THIEF, Tribes: Ascend, XCOM, Outlast, Xeno Clash II, and on and on and on the list goes!And for each game you could have different interactions and achievements, possibly even hard mode scenarios where you have to work around the NPCs that are there, such as cleaning up around workers in the slums of Finkton, or having to clean up around the club goers on Omega while being able to interact with the local barman. The potential for this game is all but endless.My point is if you haven't had a chance to play this hilarious game, do so. Go and download the Alpha off their website (Google it ya bums!) and if you like it, spend the $2.49 and support the creators. I would very much like to see more of this game in the future.
